data.title: Great Irish fare and live music!
data.text: Fiddler's Hearth is a wonderful, family owned Irish pub! Many people are regulars. The menu has traditional Irish food as well as a range of healthy and indulgent fare. Our family and friends have never been disappointed with any choice. The beers are perfect with the food. I highly recommend this restaurant!

data.title: Hit & miss ......
data.text: I'm a fan of this establishment because of it's atmosphere and selection of ales however my last couple of experiences with regard to the food is somewhat disappointing. Although it's a couple of months since I last visited FH my recent trip to Scotland where I indulged in a delicious steak & Guinness pie stuffed with beef brought back a memory of my last visit to FH when I had the "steak" & Guinness pie. Despite being tasty it was very disappointing in that it literally had TWO pieces of beef in the entire dish! Perhaps I was just unlucky but perhaps they need to ensure that what is served relates to what is described on the menu.

data.title: Irish Lunch
data.text: We went to South Bend and picked Fiddler's Hearth for our lunch. We had the smoked salmon dip with a great rosemary garlic bread for an opener. Ordered the Bangers & Mash, Fish & Chips, and the Ham & Brie sandwich among the three of us. The food was fast and hot, and the beer selection was great.  The fish and the Ham were great. The bangers were a little dry. Great atmosphere and good place for lunch.

data.title: Great little Irish pub
data.text: We stopped here for drinks last weekend.  Loved it.  A great, authentic little Irish pub.  They have live Irish music and Guiness and Harp on tap.  What else could you ask for.  My only gripe was that we wanted to sit in the bar area but it's so tiny you can literally fit like 8 people in there.

data.title: Always stop here when in the area
data.text: Best Irish Pub in the Midwest, if not anywhere. Got the banger boxty, sausage wrapped in a potato pancake.  Along with a pint of Black and Tan, what fun.  Try their Shepherd's Pie or the Irish Stew for a treat from the homeland.

data.title: Traditional Irish Pub: A great eating experience!
data.text: A great eating experience!  Cozy, well-decorated, authentic Irish pub dining room, great atmosphere, friendly and attentive service. We were four at the table, everyone totally satisfied with his meal: steak and Guinness pie, shepherd's pie, Molly Malone stew and fish and chips. Good Irish imported beer as well. It's a favorite in our family!

data.title: A touch of the old country
data.text: Authentic Irish specialties, beverages, and live music nightly. The lamb stew was excellent, as was the boxty with steak and mushrooms. Although it was not a game night, the place was loud and lively with people sharing tables. A most enjoyable evening.

data.title: Nice local pub
data.text: Had a good burger and fries, great beer selection, and a nice irish pub aesthetic. Was full on a Wednesday night

data.title: Nice place
data.text: Good wings, soup and beer. We didn't stay long. They need to update the online menus they don't have the pretzel anymore and that was disappointing and my only flaw.

data.title: really good and friendly irish pub.
data.text: This a great place to go with friends and family. Really good beers and other drinks. The Irish Stew is yummy.

data.title: Love this place!
data.text: One of our absolute favorite places!  Love the "Irish pub" atmosphere. The fish and chips, served in newspaper, are our favorite!  Have to get it every time!  Our grandson likes their chicken tenders. They are hand breaded, not the frozen variety.  Our daughter loves the vegetarian boxty. Great food!

data.title: Dark and yummy
data.text: What a nice little pub! Was just here for lunch. They make a terrific reuben, with amazing corn beef. Nothing better to go with it on a rainy day than a fabulous Irish coffee made right in front of you with cream that puts the auld country cream to shame. Lots of parking and rest rooms tot-friendly too.

data.title: Love, love, love this place
data.text: Food is without exception very good to excellent, combined with great decor and atmosphere.  Rotating beer selection is superb, recommendations are spot on.  But it is the food that makes a stop at Fiddler's obligatory for all my visits to SB.  There's some magic being worked in the kitchen, as even the most ordinary of dishes come out tasting memorable.  The boxty are things of beauty, pure and simple.

data.title: Superb cosy Pub with very good food
data.text:
It's a typical Irish pub with very good food and an enormous selection of beers and single malt whiskey. Very friendly waiter & excellent service.
Super price/quality relation. Life music at some days per week. 
A “must go” in South Bend.

data.title: My Favorite Irish bar in South Bend
data.text: Went Monday evening for dinner with my wife.  The place was fairly packed. We sat at the bar. We drank some Smithwicks and some Harp beer as to keep in the tradition. We ordered the beef boxty, and also the chicken pie. The boxty was chunks of beef stew inside a potato pancake along with peas and a brown gravy. The beef just melted in my mouth. The chicken was like a pasty with chicken and potatoes.  Also very good. Along side of each dish was served some of the best carrots I have ever had. This is a cozy, warm atmosphere with a fireplace in front of which a group of local musicians play their fiddles and jam. I really like this place! The bartender was very friendly and informative. So much so I can't wait to go back! You must try this place, and you will see why it is top rated on Trip Advisor!

data.title: Great Irish pub
data.text: We stopped in for a last minute dinner. After checking trip advisor. We were glad we did. Loved the décor of this place. And the beer and food was awesome. Our server seemed a little mixed up at times but did not take away from the experience. Would definitely go back when we are in the area.

data.title: Died and gone to heaven!
data.text: Wow, wow. The real deal, and that means a lot. Irish like Cajun and sushi, although the very idea abhorrent for me, can go thorough PC trends and reciprocate  popularity. We wane currently in Chicago, but here in the heart land stands Fiddlers and always will, as will be the holy trinity of Harp Guinness and  Bass. Tattoo that.

data.title: Great atmosphere, super friendly staff, but food just OK
data.text: Place was packed, the atmosphere felt like an old Irish pub, common large table seating and stages for live music.  Servers are super friendly and efficient.  The downside is the food.  Reuben was soggy, and thousand island was on the side... the corn beef was not a red color but more a dark brown chunk kind a meat, very odd and not great.  Brussels sprouts as a side lacked flavor.  I'd come again for a beer and entertainment but wouldn't eat here.

data.title: Fish and Chips YUM
data.text: Great food and wonderful ambiance.  Old World community pub feel - fireplace, bar, small nooks and big gather around tables.  Add to that live music nights and you have a great 'grab the group' and go place.  Best fish and chips I have ever had and a good selection of whiskeys!

data.title: You can,t eat atmosphere !
data.text: The atmosphere is great !  The food is not great.  The description of the food on the menu is wonderful, however when you get your food it certainly does not match the description.  Items are somehow left out?  Go there to drink beer not eat.
